DOC.brief_title: Low-Intensity Physical Therapy Prevention Pre Postpartum Urinary Incontinence
DOC.detailed_description: The study investigate physiotherapy prevention urinary incontinence pregnancy use intensive pelvic floor muscle training . While physical therapy appear effective prevent urinary incontinence , extensive physical therapy costly implement preventive measure general population . Thus , want asses non-intensive pelvic floor therapy decrease urinary incidence incontinence pregnancy postpartum . We propose prospective randomize controlled trial obtain baseline data effect non-intensive pelvic floor muscle training urinary incontinence primigravid woman .
DOC.criteria: Nulliparous , pregnant woman , 18 year old Less 20 week gestation Able give consent willing participate Multiparous woman Women present 20 week gestation History urinary incontinence Mentally impaired woman woman neurological impairment affect ability perform pelvic floor muscle training
